Q: Why the person is repeatedly hitting the golf stick into the ground in the video?
A:
In the given video, the person is repeatedly hitting the golf stick into the ground multiple times while playing golf in a sand trap. This action is taken to advance the golf ball out of the sand trap and onto the course.
In golf, a sand trap, also known as a bunker, is a hazard on the golf course that is intended to stop the golf ball from rolling into a hole. To play a golf shot out of a sand trap, a player will usually use a golf club to strike the ball while it lies within the sand. The clubhead must strike the ball with a downward angle to cause it to dig into the sand and then roll up, allowing the ball to emerge from the trap.
